meanings.definition: A type of ancient ship propelled by two banks of oars.
meanings.sent1: The biremes glided gracefully across the sea with their oars rowing in unison.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed a replica of the biremes used by ancient sailors.
meanings.sent3: The biremes decided to have a race to see which one could row the fastest.
meanings.sent4: In the sea of life, we are all biremes rowing towards our goals.
meanings.sent5: The biremes' oars sliced through the water, leaving a trail of foam behind.

meanings.definition: A bireme is a type of galley or ancient warship that is propelled by two rows of oars.
meanings.sent1: The biremes were essential in ancient naval battles, dominating the seas with their speed.
meanings.sent2: Historians studied the design of biremes to understand ancient naval warfare tactics.
meanings.sent3: The biremes threw a party to celebrate their victory in the battle of the oars.
meanings.sent4: The biremes symbolized the power and might of the ancient naval fleets.
meanings.sent5: The biremes' oarsmen synchronized their movements perfectly, propelling the ship forward.
